questions.question: How is UK income tax calculated?
questions.answer: UK income tax is calculated on your taxable income after personal allowance. Tax is paid at different rates depending on your total income level.

questions.question: What is National Insurance?
questions.answer: National Insurance is a tax that helps pay for state benefits and the NHS. Both employees and employers contribute.

questions.question: Do I have to pay tax on my salary?
questions.answer: If your salary exceeds the personal allowance (£12,570 in 2024/25), you will pay income tax. National Insurance is paid on earnings over £12,570.

questions.question: How do student loans affect my take-home pay?
questions.answer: Student loan repayments are deducted directly from your salary at 9% of earnings above the threshold (£24,366 for Plan 1, £27,295 for Plan 2).
